intro: Achyronia exigua, commonly known as the small-leaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruits are small, green berries that turn red when mature. Achyronia exigua is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
